metadata.Title: CVE-2023-30086 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability found in Libtiff V.4.0.7 allows a local attacker to cause a denial of service via the tiffcp function in tiffcp.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm7
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm7
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm7
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ccdm94> it seems like this issue has the same fix as the one for CVE-2022-3599, which has already been patched in several releases as per USN-5714-1.

criterions.comment: tiff package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm7').
